PARS package¶

pars.family_architectures module¶

pars.family_architectures.family_architectures(name, clan=False)¶

Get domains architectures for given name.

Parameters

  • name (str) – pfam access key

  • clan (bool) – Is entry a clan?

Result

list of PfamArchitecture objects

Rettype

list

pars.hammer_to_object module¶

pars.hammer_to_object.file_to_object(filename)¶

function which enables to pars HMMER profile file to object

Parameters

filename (str) – name or path of HMMER profile file

Returns

HMMERProfileFileBuilder object build from file

Return type

HMMERProfileFileBuilder object

pars.hammer_to_object.to_dict(tab, mode)¶

function to change list to dictionary of emmision (match or insert) -log 0.25 probabilities or transition -log 0.25 probabilities

Parameters

  • tab (list) – list of -log 0.25 probabilities from line of file

  • mode (int) – 1 for “match_emission” line of file, 2 for “insert_emission” line of file and 3 for “state_transition” line of file as is the order in HMM block

Returns

dictionary of emmision -log 0.25 probabilities and transition -log 0.25 probabilities

Return type

dict

pars.hmm_autosearch module¶

pars.hmm_autosearch.automatic_search(hmm_dir, fasta_dir, out_dir, mode)¶

function for automatic search against profiles

Parameters

  • hmm_dir (str) – name of directory with HMMER profiles files

  • fasta_dir (str) – name of directory with fasta files

  • out_dir (str) – name of directory for outputs

  • mode (str) – “scan” for hmmscan or “search” for hmmsearch of HMMER tool

Returns

outputs for hmmscan or hmmsearch

Return type

file

pars.hmmer_command module¶

pars.hmmer_command.hmmpress(path='hmmpress', h=None, f=None, hmm_file=None)¶

Wrapper for HMMpress tool from HAMMER (description from HAMMER manual)

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to hmmscan tool

  • h (bool) – Help; print a brief reminder of command line usage and all available options - optional

  • f (bool) – Force; overwrites any previous hmmpress’ed datafiles. The default is to bitch about any existing files and ask you to delete them first - optional

  • hmm_file (str) – directory of hmm file

  • fasta_file (str) – directory of fasta file

Returns

output from hmmpress - prepared profiles files

Return type

file

pars.hmmer_command.hmmscan(path='hmmscan', h=False, o='out', tblout=False, domtblout=False, pfamtblout=False, acc=False, noali=False, notextw=False, textw=False, E=False, T=False, domE=False, domT=False, incE=False, incT=False, incdomE=False, incdomT=False, cut_ga=False, cut_nc=False, cut_tc=False, max=False, F1=False, F2=False, F3=False, nobias=False, nonull2=False, Z=False, domZ=False, seed=False, qformat=False, cpu=False, stall=False, MPI=False, hmm_file=False, fasta_file=False)¶

Wrapper for HMMscan tool from HAMMER (description from HAMMER manual)

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to hmmscan tool

  • h (bool) – Help; print a brief reminder of command line usage and all available options- optional

  • o (str) – Direct the main human-readable output to a file <f> instead of the default stdout

  • tblout (str, optional) – Save a simple tabular (space-delimited) file summarizing the per-target output, with one data line per homologous target model found

  • domtblout (str, optional) – Save a simple tabular (space-delimited) file summarizing the per-domain output, with one data line per homologous domain detected in a query sequence for each homologous model

  • pfamtblout (str, optional) – Save an especially succinct tabular (space-delimited) file summarizing the per-target output, with one data line per homologous target model found. hmmer user’s guide 99

  • acc (bool) – Use accessions instead of names in the main output, where available for profiles and/or sequences - optional

  • noali (bool) – Omit the alignment section from the main output. This can greatly reduce the output volume - optional

  • notextw (bool) – Unlimit the length of each line in the main output. The default is a limit of 120 characters per line, which helps in displaying the output cleanly on terminals and in editors, but can truncate target profile description lines - optional

  • textw (int, optional) – Set the main output’s line length limit to <n> characters per line. The default is 120

  • E (float, optional) – In the per-target output, report target profiles with an Evalue of <= <x>. The default is 10.0, meaning that on average, about 10 false positives will be reported per query, so you can see the top of the noise and decide for yourself if it’s really noise

  • T (float, optional) – Instead of thresholding per-profile output on E-value, instead report target profiles with a bit score of >= <x>

  • domE (float, optional) – In the per-domain output, for target profiles that have already satisfied the per-profile reporting threshold, report individual domains with a conditional E-value of <= <x>

  • domT (float, optional) – Instead of thresholding per-domain output on E-value, instead report domains with a bit score of >= <x>. Options for Inclusion Thresholds

  • incE (float, optional) – Use an E-value of <= <x> as the per-target inclusion threshold. The default is 0.01, meaning that on average, about 1 100 sean r. eddy false positive would be expected in every 100 searches with different query sequences

  • incT (float, optional) – Instead of using E-values for setting the inclusion threshold, instead use a bit score of >= <x> as the per-target inclusion threshold. It would be unusual to use bit score thresholds with hmmscan, because you don’t expect a single score threshold to work for different profiles; different profiles have slightly different expected score distributions

  • incdomE (float, optional) – Use a conditional E-value of <= <x> as the per-domain inclusion threshold, in targets that have already satisfied the overall per-target inclusion threshold. The default is 0.01.

  • incdomT – has been applied specifically using each model’s curated thresholds

  • cut_ga (bool) – Use the GA (gathering) bit scores in the model to set persequence (GA1) and per-domain (GA2) reporting and inclusion thresholds. GA thresholds are generally considered to be the reliable curated thresholds defining family membership; for example_fasta, in Pfam, these thresholds define what gets included in Pfam Full alignments based on searches with Pfam Seed models - optional

  • cut_nc (bool) – Use the NC (noise cutoff) bit score thresholds in the model to set per-sequence (NC1) and per-domain (NC2) reporting and inclusion thresholds. NC thresholds are generally considered to be the score of the highest-scoring known false positive - optional

  • cut_tc (bool) – Use the NC (trusted cutoff) bit score thresholds in the model to set per-sequence (TC1) and per-domain (TC2) reporting and inclusion thresholds. TC thresholds are generally considered to be the score of the lowest-scoring known true positive that is above all known false positives. hmmer user’s guide 101 - optional

  • max (bool) – Turn off all filters, including the bias filter, and run full Forward/Backward postprocessing on every target. This increases sensitivity somewhat, at a large cost in speed

  • F1 (float, optional) – Stage 1 (MSV) threshold: promote hits w/ P <= F1 [0.02]

  • F2 (float, optional) – Stage 2 (Vit) threshold: promote hits w/ P <= F2 [1e-3]

  • F3 (float, optional) – Stage 3 (Fwd) threshold: promote hits w/ P <= F3 [1e-5]

  • nobias (bool) – Turn off the bias filter. This increases sensitivity somewhat, but can come at a high cost in speed, especially if the query has biased residue composition (such as a repetitive sequence region, or if it is a membrane protein - optional

  • nonull2 (bool) – Turn off the null2 score corrections for biased composition - optional

  • Z (float, optional) – Assert that the total number of targets in your searches is <x>, for the purposes of per-sequence E-value calculations, rather than the actual number of targets seen - optional

  • domZ (bool) – Assert that the total number of targets in your searches is <x>, for the purposes of per-domain conditional E-value calculations, rather than the number of targets that passed the reporting thresholds.

  • seed (int, optional) – Set the random number seed to <n>. Some steps in postprocessing require Monte Carlo simulation. The default is to use a fixed seed (42), so that results are exactly reproducible. 102 sean r. eddy Any other positive integer will give different (but also reproducible) results. A choice of 0 uses an arbitrarily chosen seed - optional

  • qformat (str, optional) – Assert that input seqfile is in format <s>, bypassing format autodetection. Common choices for <s> include: fasta, embl, genbank. Alignment formats also work; common choices include: stockholm, a2m, afa, psiblast, clustal, phylip. For more information, and for codes for some less common formats, see main documentation. The string <s> is case-insensitive (fasta or FASTA both work).

  • cpu (int, optional) – Set the number of parallel worker threads to <n>. On multicore machines, the default is 2. You can also control this number by setting an environment variable, HMMER_NCPU. There is also a master thread, so the actual number of threads that HMMER spawns is <n>+1. This option is not available if HMMER was compiled with POSIX threads support turned off

  • stall (bool) – For debugging the MPI master/worker version: pause after start, to enable the developer to attach debuggers to the running master and worker(s) processes. Send SIGCONT signal to release the pause. (Under gdb: (gdb) signal SIGCONT) (Only available if optional MPI support was enabled at compiletime.) - optional

  • MPI (bool) – Run under MPI control with master/worker parallelization (using mpirun, for example_fasta, or equivalent). Only available if optional MPI support was enabled at compile-time. Required argumnets - optional

  • hmm_file (str) – directory of hmm file

  • fasta_file (str) – directory of fasta file

Returns

output file from hmmscan

Return type

file

pars.hmmer_command.hmmsearch(path='hmmsearch', h=False, o='out', A=False, tblout=False, domtblout=False, pfamtblout=False, acc=False, noali=False, notextw=False, textw=False, E=False, T=False, domE=False, domT=False, incE=False, incT=False, incdomE=False, incdomT=False, cut_ga=False, cut_nc=False, cut_tc=False, max=False, F1=False, F2=False, F3=False, nobias=False, nonull=False, Z=False, domZ=False, seed=False, tformat=False, cpu=False, hmm_file=False, fasta_file=False)¶

Wrapper for HMMsearch tool from HAMMER (description from HAMMER manual)

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to hmmscan tool

  • h (bool) – Help; print a brief reminder of command line usage and all available options - optional

  • o (str) – direct output to file <f>, not stdout

  • A (str, optional) – save multiple alignment of all hits to file <f>

  • tblout (str, optional) – save parseable table of per-sequence hits to file <f>

  • domtblout (str, optional) – save parseable table of per-domain hits to file <f>

  • pfamtblout (str, optional) – save table of hits and domains to file, in Pfam format <f>

  • acc (bool) – prefer accessions over names in output - optional

  • noali (bool) – don’t output alignments, so output is smaller - optional

  • notextw (bool) – unlimit ASCII text output line width - optional

  • textw (int, optional) – set max width of ASCII text output lines [120] (n>=120)

  • E (float, optional) – report sequences <= this E-value threshold in output [10.0] (x>0)

  • T (float, optional) – report sequences >= this score threshold in output

  • domE (float, optional) – report domains <= this E-value threshold in output [10.0] (x>0)

  • domT (float, optional) – report domains >= this score cutoff in output

  • incE (float, optional) – consider sequences <= this E-value threshold as significant

  • incT (float, optional) – consider sequences >= this score threshold as significant

  • incdomE (float, optional) – consider domains <= this E-value threshold as significant

  • incdomT (float, optional) – consider domains >= this score threshold as significant

  • cut_ga (bool) – use profile’s GA gathering cutoffs to set all thresholding - optional

  • cut_nc (bool) – use profile’s NC noise cutoffs to set all thresholding - optional

  • cut_tc (bool) – use profile’s TC trusted cutoffs to set all thresholding - optional

  • max (bool) – Turn all heuristic filters off (less speed, more power) - optional

  • F1 (float, optional) – Stage 1 (MSV) threshold: promote hits w/ P <= F1 [0.02]

  • F2 (float, optional) – Stage 2 (Vit) threshold: promote hits w/ P <= F2 [1e-3]

  • F3 (float, optional) – Stage 3 (Fwd) threshold: promote hits w/ P <= F3 [1e-5]

  • nobias (bool) – turn off composition bias filter - optional

  • nonull (bool) – turn off biased composition score corrections - optional

  • Z (float, optional) – set # of comparisons done, for E-value calculation

  • domZ (float, optional) – set # of significant seqs, for domain E-value calculation

  • seed (int, optional) – set RNG seed to <n> (if 0: one-time arbitrary seed) [42]

  • tformat (str, optional) – assert target <seqfile> is in format <s>: no autodetection

  • cpu (int, optional) – number of parallel CPU workers to use for multithreads [1]

  • hmm_file (str) – directory of hmm file

  • fasta_file (str) – directory of fasta file

Returns

output file from hmmsearch

Return type

file

pars.hmmer_file module¶

module in which is implemented one class - HMMERProfileFileBuilder which enables to parse HMMER profile file

class pars.hmmer_file.HMMERProfileFileBuilder(version, name, acc, desc, alph, rf, mm, cons, cs, map, date, nseq, effn, cksum, ga, tc, nc, bm, sm, stats_local_msv, stats_local_viterbi, stats_local_forward, match_emission, insert_emission, state_transition)¶

Bases: object

class for parsing HMMER profile file

enables to calculate length of profile adding new positions of profile printing out object saving object to a functioning HMMER file which could be used for analisys by HMMER tool

add_position(match_emission, insert_emission, state_transition)¶

adding match_emission probabilities, insert_emission probabilities, state_transition probabilities of new position

Parameters

  • match_emission (dict) – dictionary of -log0.25 probabilities of match emission

  • insert_emission (dict) – dictionary of -log0.25 probabilities of insert emission

  • state_transition (dict) – dictionary of -log0.25 probabilities of state transition

file_format(filename)¶

save object to HMMER profile file which could be used for calculation by hmmsearch and hmmscan

Parameters

filename – name of new hmm file which will be created

Returns

hmm file

Return type

file

get_length()¶

return length of profile :return: length of profile :rtype: int

pars.pfam_family module¶

class pars.pfam_family.PfamFamily(family)¶

Bases: pars.xfam_object.XfamObject

class contains information about pfam family.

Parameters

  • access (str) – pfam access of family

  • short_name (str) – pfam id of family

  • type (str) – A type of pfam entry

  • seed_len (int) – Number o sequences tin the seed alignment of family

  • full_len (int) – Number of sequences in the full alignment of family

  • avarage_len – Avarage length of amino-acid regions in the full alignment

  • avarage_id (float) – Avarage percentage identity of sequences in the full alignment

  • avarage_coverage (float) – Fraction of whole sequence length that pfam entry covers

  • changestatus (str) – Has family been changes or been added in this pfam realse?

  • description (str) – A short description of the family

  • go_ref (list) – List of GO ids associated with a family

  • so_ref (list) – List of SO ids associated with a family

  • pubmed_ref (list) – List of Pubmed ids associated with a family

  • pdb_ref (list) – List of PDB names associated with a family

Type

float

pars.pfam_sequences.family_seq(families, form='fasta', type='full', download=False, path=None)¶

This function search for sequences of the family in format and form specified by the user.

Parameters

  • families (str or list) – Id or accession of the family, or list of the families names

  • form (str, optional) – Output format of ssequences. Available: fasta, selex, stockholm, msf, defaults to fasta

  • type (str, optional) – A type of the sequences from the fmaily site. Available: full, seed, defaults to full

  • download (bool optional) – ‘True’ if download to the file, defaults to False

  • path (str, optional) – path to the outpur file if download is True

Returns

List of SeqIO type objects

Return type

list

pars.pfam_sequences.family_tree(families, download=False, path=None)¶

This function search for phylogenetic tree of the family in the Newick format.

Parameters

  • families (str or list) – Id or accession of the family, or list of the families names

  • download (bool optional) – ‘True’ if download to the file, defaults to False

  • path (str, optional) – path to the outpur file if download is True

Returns

List of PhyloIO type objects

Return type

list
